trans-unit.source: Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps have several options for user authentication, ranging from simple single sign-on (SSO) using [Web authentication broker](web-authentication-broker.md) to highly secure two-factor authentication.
trans-unit.target: Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps have several options for user authentication, ranging from simple single sign-on (SSO) using [Web authentication broker](web-authentication-broker.md) to highly secure two-factor authentication.

trans-unit.source: For regular app connections to third-party identity provider services, such as Facebook, Twitter, Flickr, and so on, use the [Web authentication broker](web-authentication-broker.md).
trans-unit.target: For regular app connections to third-party identity provider services, such as Facebook, Twitter, Flickr, and so on, use the [Web authentication broker](web-authentication-broker.md).

trans-unit.source: For added convenience, use [Credential Locker](credential-locker.md) to save and roam the user's login information.
trans-unit.target: For added convenience, use [Credential Locker](credential-locker.md) to save and roam the user's login information.

trans-unit.source: Enterprises using Windows 10 should strongly consider using [Microsoft Passport and Windows Hello](microsoft-passport.md), which enables highly secure two-factor authentication.
trans-unit.target: Enterprises using Windows 10 should strongly consider using [Microsoft Passport and Windows Hello](microsoft-passport.md), which enables highly secure two-factor authentication.

trans-unit.source: If using Microsoft Passport is not possible,[Smart cards](smart-cards.md) and [Fingerprint biometrics](fingerprint-biometrics.md) can add an additional layer of security.
trans-unit.target: If using Microsoft Passport is not possible,[Smart cards](smart-cards.md) and [Fingerprint biometrics](fingerprint-biometrics.md) can add an additional layer of security.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Passport and Windows Hello
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Passport and Windows Hello

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Passport and Windows Hello replaces passwords with strong two-factor authentication (2FA) by verifying existing credentials and by creating a device-specific credential that a biometric or PIN-based user gesture protects.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Passport and Windows Hello replaces passwords with strong two-factor authentication (2FA) by verifying existing credentials and by creating a device-specific credential that a biometric or PIN-based user gesture protects.

trans-unit.source: This combination effectively replaces physical and virtual smart cards as well as reusable passwords for logon and access control.
trans-unit.target: This combination effectively replaces physical and virtual smart cards as well as reusable passwords for logon and access control.

trans-unit.source: Credential Locker
trans-unit.target: Credential Locker

trans-unit.source: Credential Locker is a convenient and secure way to store user credentials that your app uses to connect to services like media, social networking, and so on.
trans-unit.target: Credential Locker is a convenient and secure way to store user credentials that your app uses to connect to services like media, social networking, and so on.

trans-unit.source: You can store a user's userid and password in the Credential Locker, and then automatically log them on to services when they use your app.
trans-unit.target: You can store a user's userid and password in the Credential Locker, and then automatically log them on to services when they use your app.

trans-unit.source: Credentials stored in the Credential Locker automatically roam with a users's Microsoft Account.
trans-unit.target: Credentials stored in the Credential Locker automatically roam with a users's Microsoft Account.

trans-unit.source: Web authentication broker
trans-unit.target: Web authentication broker

trans-unit.source: Web authentication broker supports the OAuth and OpenID internet authentication protocols, so you can integrate your app with a web service that provides user authentication.
trans-unit.target: Web authentication broker supports the OAuth and OpenID internet authentication protocols, so you can integrate your app with a web service that provides user authentication.

trans-unit.source: This allows you to utilize user identity in your apps from services such as Facebook, Flickr, Google, and Twitter.
trans-unit.target: This allows you to utilize user identity in your apps from services such as Facebook, Flickr, Google, and Twitter.

trans-unit.source: You can also use the web authentication broker to enable single sign-on (SSO) for multiple internet authenticated apps.
trans-unit.target: You can also use the web authentication broker to enable single sign-on (SSO) for multiple internet authenticated apps.

trans-unit.source: Fingerprint biometrics
trans-unit.target: Fingerprint biometrics

trans-unit.source: Including a request for fingerprint authentication when the user must consent to a particular action increases the security of your app.
trans-unit.target: Including a request for fingerprint authentication when the user must consent to a particular action increases the security of your app.

trans-unit.source: For example, you could require fingerprint authentication before authorizing an in-app purchase, or access to restricted resources.
trans-unit.target: For example, you could require fingerprint authentication before authorizing an in-app purchase, or access to restricted resources.

trans-unit.source: Fingerprint authentication is managed using the [UserConsentVerifier](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn279134) class in the [Windows.Security.Credentials.UI](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701356) namespace.
trans-unit.target: Fingerprint authentication is managed using the [UserConsentVerifier](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn279134) class in the [Windows.Security.Credentials.UI](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701356) namespace.

trans-unit.source: Smart cards
trans-unit.target: Smart cards

trans-unit.source: Smart cards and virtual smart cards provide a high level of authentication for your app.
trans-unit.target: Smart cards and virtual smart cards provide a high level of authentication for your app.

trans-unit.source: You can use the APIs in the [Windows.Devices.SmartCards](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn263949) namespace to authenticate a user using a smart card, gather information about smart card devices, and manage smart card devices, such as requesting a PIN reset.
trans-unit.target: You can use the APIs in the [Windows.Devices.SmartCards](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn263949) namespace to authenticate a user using a smart card, gather information about smart card devices, and manage smart card devices, such as requesting a PIN reset.

trans-unit.source: You can also create Trusted Platform Module (TPM) Virtual Smart Cards that provide smart card-level authentication without requiring a physical smart card from your user.
trans-unit.target: You can also create Trusted Platform Module (TPM) Virtual Smart Cards that provide smart card-level authentication without requiring a physical smart card from your user.

trans-unit.source: Shared certificates
trans-unit.target: Shared certificates

trans-unit.source: Certificate authentication provides a high level of trust when authenticating a user.
trans-unit.target: Certificate authentication provides a high level of trust when authenticating a user.

trans-unit.source: Apps that require secure authentication beyond a userid and password combination can use certificates for authentication.
trans-unit.target: Apps that require secure authentication beyond a userid and password combination can use certificates for authentication.
